Key Match Events: England struggled for cohesion and defensive security, especially against Greece's counters in a 2-1 Wembley defeat.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley intends to return to a more familiar system against Finland, as he looks for a reaction to England's shapeless display in Thursday's 2-1 Wembley defeat by Greece.
Carsley suggests he would not have gone with the 4-2-4 system without a recognised No 9 if Harry Kane had been fit.
Carsley is hoping to return in Helsinki.
Post-Match Reflections: Carsley takes blame for defeat to Greece.
Carsley: 'I have got to lead by example and I will.'
Carsley believes his team hasn't changed, despite the loss.
Carsley is wary about ruling out the 4-2-4 system quickly, despite it not working out.
Carsley remains focused on the Nations League fixtures.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harry Kane missed out with a minor groin problem.
Carsley retains a good deal of support within the FA hierarchy.
Carsley expects Harry Kane to feature in Helsinki.
Others: The Football Association will not allow one game to determine everything in Lee Carsley's interim tenure.
Carsley has the final two ties of the Nations League campaign in November â€“ against Greece in Athens and the Republic of Ireland at Wembley.
